contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionarypar|scat}} {{TOCright}} '''Scat''' or '''SCAT''' may refer to: ==Education== * [[School and College Ability Test]] ==Games== * [[Thirty-one (game)]], a card game * ''[[S.C.A.T.: Special Cybernetic Attack Team]]'', a video game for the Nintendo Entertainment System by Natsume ==Excrement== * [[Feces]], a waste product produced in the digestive tract * [[Coprophilia]], a sexual fetish involving feces ==Music== * [[Scat singing]], a kind of vocal improvisation common in jazz * [[Scat Records]], a record label * [[Scatman John]], a singer * [[Scatman Crothers]], U.S. musician and actor ==Transportation== * [[SCAT (airline)]], an airline based in Kazakhstan * [[SCAT (automobile)]] an Italian automobile manufacturer * [[Sarasota County Area Transit]], a public transportation system in Florida * [[South Coast Area Transit]], a public transportation system in California * [[Space Coast Area Transit]], a public transportation system in Florida * SCATS 'Sydney Co-ordinated Adaptive Traffic System', Traffic network Operating System ==Other== * ''[[Scatophagidae]]'', a family of fishes * [[South Pacific Combat Air Transport Command]], a joint command of U.S. forces in World War II * [[Scanning Acoustic Tomography]], a research process using focused sound * Somerville Community Access Television, a local television station in [[Somerville, Massachusetts]] * [[Scat (novel)]], a novel for young adults written by Carl Hiaasen ==See also== * [[Skat (disambiguation)]] {{disambig}}
